alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 8:54AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Alameda and Contra Costa counties. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakland, Berkeley, Richmond, San Leandro, Alameda, San Pablo, El Cerrito, Hercules, Albany, Pinole, Piedmont, Emeryville, Kensington, El Sobrante, Rollingwood, Tara Hills, Rodeo, East Richmond Heigts, East Richmond Heights and Bayview-Montalvin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
